results.title: The Lion tamer
results.creator_credit: Amadee J Van Beuren, Van Beuren Corporation, Official Films and George Stallings
results.brief_description: Amos (Freeman Gosden) and Andy (Charles Correll) become lion tamers at the circus. With the real lion being too ferocious, Amos and Andy decide to trick the crowd by “taming” a fake lion - a lion costume with two men inside. However, the real lion escapes and unbeknownst to Amos, gets into the cage with him, whilst the fake lion runs away. All hell breaks loose as Amos tries to fend off the hungry lion.

results.title: The Lion King: Timon and Pumbaa
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Pictures, Tony Craig, Bobs Gannaway, Rob LaDuca, Steve Moore and Jeff DeGrandis
results.brief_description: The Lion King’s lovable pals Timon and Pumbaa enjoy starring roles in their first solo video. Pumbaa is struck by lightning and as a result develops amnesia and has no recollection of his friend Timon and the adventures they have shared. Timon tries his hardest to restore his friends memory, and recalls some of their adventures around the world.

results.title: The Lion king
results.creator_credit: Don Hahn, Walt Disney Pictures, Roger Allers and Rob Minkoff
results.brief_description: This beautifully animated and wonderfully scored feature film tells the story of the love between a proud lion ruler, Mufasa, and his son, Simba - a naive and curious cub who must find his place in the “circle of life”. Through the help of his friends, and his determination to meet the toughest challenges, Simba eventually takes his place as the rightful ruler of the Pride Lands. His search to meet his destiny puts him face to face in a struggle to the death with his evil uncle Scar and also leads him towards true love. Elton John and Tim Rice’s award winning songs, an excellent score by Hans Zimmer, and voice characterisations by Jeremy Irons, James Earl Jones, Rowan Atkinson, Robert Guillame, Moira Kelly and Matthew Broderick as Simba, make this an unforgettable experience.

constellations_other.name: The drama and nuance of silhouette
constellations_other.description: Ali Gumillya Baker uses silhouette to evocative effect in her work reimagining the colonial gaze. The lighting technique has long been employed by filmmakers for its ability to dramatically convey a wide variety of emotions in everything from film noir to animation and whimsy.

results.title: The Lion in winter
results.creator_credit: Martin Poll, Avco Embassy, Hawarth Product Ltd and Anthony Harvey
results.brief_description: Based on the play by James Goldman and winner of three Academy Awards. The story of Henry II (Peter O’Toole) and his estranged wife Eleanor of Aquitaine (Katharine Hepburn), is one of the most fascinating in history. Set in Chinon Castle in 12th Century France, the film centres on the royal couple’s remarkable love-hate relationship, which ranges from tender to tempestuous as they connive and cajole to decide which of their three sons will succeed to the English throne.

results.title: The Lion in the doorway
results.creator_credit: Christina Ferguson, Macau Light Films, O J Productions and Prabhubodha Walker
results.brief_description: A satirical, experimental, metaphysical western. A cowboy figure joins those of Icarus and Pierrot and encounters some less than lovely aspects of wild west culture.

results.title: The Lion and the mouse
results.creator_credit: Wolf Koenig, ONF | NFB and Evelyn Lambart
results.brief_description: This film is a visual adaptation of the famous Aesop Fable “The Lion and the Mouse”. Delightfully rendered, it is an exquisite tapestry of animation cut-outs. Sound film without commentary.

results.title: The Lion and the mouse
results.brief_description: Through an amusing cartoon interpretation of an Aesopean fable, children learn that size alone does not determine how helpful a person can be. We see the king of the jungle, a lion, laugh at the idea that a tiny mouse could ever help him. But when a speck of dirt gets into the lion’s eye, it is the little mouse who removes it and proves to be a helpful friend after all.

results.title: The Lion and the lamb
results.creator_credit: Thames and Clyde Film Company and Stanley L Russell
results.brief_description: The work of animal care and protection in Scotland which, under the guidance of the Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals and with the support of enlightened legislastion, enforces specific standards of animal welfare, and ensures that they are housed and fed according to their special needs and properly cared for in the course of training, working and when in transit.

results.title: The Linguini incident
results.creator_credit: Arnold Orgolini, Linguini Productions and Richard Shepard
results.brief_description: 2 women with unfulfilled dreams and 1 man with a gambling debt embark on a pact to rob a nightclub. Waitress Lucy (Rosanna Arquette) aspires to be Lucy the Ethereal, a female Houdini, but has not made a spectacular escape since childhood. Her friend, Viv (Eszter Balint), wants to create her own line of avant-garde lingerie but is finding it hard to make a start, and Monte (David Bowie) is a gambling addict who says he needs to marry before the end of the week or his life is in danger. Together, they rob the nightclub and Lucy agrees to marry Monte, however when the wedding falls through Monte loses yet another bet and it’s up to be Lucy to be Lucy the Ethereal once and for all to settle the accumulated $4 million dollar debt. Bowie’s real life wife, Iman, makes a cameo as a nightclub guest.

results.title: The Linesmen
results.creator_credit: British Information Services, AEI Film Unit and Peter Griffiths
results.brief_description: The engineer in charge of erecting pylons and transmission cables for the overhead grid system in North Wales, vividly describes the work. It is exacting and often dangerous. The survey of the proposed route is seen, also the testing of a new type of tower shows examples of skilled methods and modern equipment used.
